title: Nearly $100 billion in deposits pulled from banks; officials call system 'sound and resilient'
description: Regulators again assured the public that the system is safe, which came as data showed customers pulled nearly $100 billion in deposits.

title: Watch live: Joe Biden, Justin Trudeau hold press conference in Canada
description: President Joe Biden addressed Canada's Parliament, then will hold a joint press conference with Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau.

title: Deutsche Bank is not the next Credit Suisse, analysts say as panic spreads
description: Central banks and regulators had hoped that the Credit Suisse rescue deal would help calm investor jitters about the stability of Europe's banks.

title: Europe's leaders battle banking crisis as market rout hangs over Brussels summit
description: Shares of Deutsche Bank traded more than 14% lower at one point Friday after a Thursday evening surge for its credit default swaps.

title: British regulator softens stance on Microsoft-Activision deal competition concerns
description: The U.K.'s competition regulator on Friday said it has narrowed the scope of its investigation into Microsoft's takeover of Activision.

title: King Charles' visit to France postponed after wave of protests
Deutsche Bank shares slide 9% after sudden spike in the cost of insuring against its default
description: Deutsche Bank shares fell 9% in early trade on Friday after a spike in credit default swaps on Thursday night, as concerns about the stability of Europe's banks persisted.

title: TikTok wants to distance itself from China — but Beijing is getting involved
description: China said that it would "strongly oppose" a forced sale of TikTok from its parent ByteDance, as the app faced intense scrutiny and a potential ban in U.S.

title: Crypto firm Tether says it has around $1.6 billion in excess reserves to back its USDT stablecoin
description: Crypto firm Tether estimates it will make $700 million in profit in the March quarter, taking its total excess reserves to over $1.6 billion, its CTO said.

title: A 'greenwashing' crackdown in Europe hasn't gone down well. Here's what you need to know
description: The EU says it is hoping to provide more clarity to consumers so that when a product is sold as green, they can trust that it is environmentally friendly.

title: CNBC Daily Open: Janet Yellen changed the mood — again
description: The federal government is prepared to take additional actions if warranted, U.S. Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said.

title: The Swiss claim the U.S. banking crisis ultimately toppled Credit Suisse. But are they right?
description: Swiss authorities placed a heavy emphasis on the role of U.S. regional banking collapses in pushing Credit Suisse to the brink.

title: China is a ‘relative safe haven’ in the face of global banking stress, Citi economists say
description: The turmoil in the banking sector seen in the U.S. and Europe has highlighted China as a "relative safe haven" this year, Citi said in a note.

title: India's travel industry may not overtake China soon but there are still 'massive' opportunities
description: India is ramping up spending on its aviation industry by billions of dollars, but its outbound travel market is unlikely to overtake China's anytime soon.

title: Estonia says China's peace plan to end Ukraine's war is 'extremely unfair'
description: Beijing sought to position itself as a peace broker between Russia and Ukraine and issued a 12-point peace plan in February.

title: 'Can't get their act together': Crypto firms slam SEC, Washington for lack of clarity on rules
description: Crypto companies are frustrated at the U.S. government and the SEC for their lack of clear rules.

title: This 26-year-old from Hong Kong is transforming a ‘dinosaur industry’ — one luxury watch at a time
description: Wristcheck is a consignment-based platform for luxury watches from Hong Kong, and it claims to have an inventory of timepieces worth $80 million.

title: These tech giants are still making money, but layoffs are coming hard and fast
description: Global tech giants from Microsoft and Google to SAP have laid off thousands of employees since the start of the year despite being profitable.
